results.title: Woman sesame oil maker [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Xie Fei, Changchun Film Studio and Tianjin Film Studio
results.brief_description: A successful career woman, the manager of a Chinese-Japanese joint venture sesame oil factory, seeks comfort from the stress of her business, a violent, alcoholic husband, and a mentally retarded son in the arms of a married man. When the young girl she has arranged to marry her son discovers her affair, she responds with sympathy to her future mother-in-law’s problems. A surprisingly close relationship develops between the two women as they struggle together against tradition and circumstance to take control of their lives. Cast includes Siqin Gaowa, Wu Yujuan, Lei Kesheng and Chen Baoguo. The film won the Golden Bear and Film Critic awards at the 43rd Berlin Film Festival 1993. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Woman as a flower = La Femme fleur
results.brief_description: Based on the drawings and etchings of Aubrey Beardsley, Gustav Klimt, Max Klinger and other artists living about the turn of the century. This film is a tribute to the women of the Edwardian era, and gives a fascinating glimpse of that time. Also of interest as a study of the Art Nouveau, which expressed the prosperity of the period.

results.title: Wolves of the sea
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Elizabeth Parer-Cook, ABC-TV (Australia), National Geographic Society and TBS Productions
results.brief_description: Killer whales are found in every ocean of the world - magnificent, highly intelligent animals that must kill to live. Each family pod has its own unique dialect, skills and traditions which are passed on through the generations. From British Columbia where they hunt down salmon, to Norway for the schools of herring, to the sub-Antarctic where the penguins and elephant seals are pursued relentlessly, and finally to Argentina where sea lion pups are picked off the beach, this outstanding video portrays the killer whales as they are - wolves of the sea. However it is presented with great empathy and understanding and is accompanied by some of the most stunning photography creating an absolute visual delight. Highly recommended family viewing. Narrated by David Attenborough.

results.title: Witness to history
results.creator_credit: Susan Eikov Green and Guidance Associates
results.brief_description: This series of four progams examines different aspects of 20th. century history. ‘Turn of the century America’ looks at the United States and the major changes which occured from 1890-1920. ‘The Russian Revolution’ features archival footage depicting this historic event. ‘WW2-The dark years in Europe’ covers the events which led to the outbreak of war in Western Europe’ ‘Europe after WW2’ looks at a range of events which shaped post-war Europe.

results.title: Without consent
results.brief_description: Attempts to gain an understanding of sexually related violence in Australia. “Every woman’s fear. Part 1”: Examines the impact of a rape which occurred in Broadford Victoria in March 1991. The effects of sexual assault on victims, their families and the community are shown through poignant interviews with victims, police and counsellors. “The Dark Side. Part 2”: Provides an insight into the mind of the rapist with offenders describing their motivations, emotions and their view of the victim. Contains a powerful interview with a victim of male sexual assault.

results.title: With the best of intentions
results.creator_credit: Bill Steller, Robin Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: This film looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Compares two professional Sydney families to show how broader social developments and conflicts are reflected in middle-class approaches to child rearing.

results.title: With music ring
results.brief_description: Featuring the Mormon Tabernacle Choir of 375 voices. Shows how the building of a great composite sound such as the Mormon Tabernacle Choir requires hard work and a man of talent on the podium.

results.title: With just a little trust
results.brief_description: An elderly black woman, her feet swollen with arthritis, marches with pride and determination through an urban ghetto to meet her daughter. Arriving ahead of her daughter, she finds an eviction notice on the door of the apartment - only the beginning of a veritable sea of troubles which mother and daughter meet together. Cast: Frances Williams, Barbara Iley.

results.title: Wireless nights
results.creator_credit: Melissa Juhanson, Chris McGill and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Each night from midnight to dawn Melbourne’s night owls and insomniacs tune their radios to the voice 3AW’s Keith McGowan. “Wireless nights” explores the richness and drama of this unique group of people, self-named “The Overnighters”, as they share their lives across the airwaves.

results.title: Wire sculpture
results.brief_description: An exploration into the design and construction of “kinetic” sculpture with steel wire and acetylene torch. Joe Police, a freelance artist, constructs a movable sculpture of a human head. He relates his experiences in learning his craft and comments on his philosophy of art and creativity. The film is complimented by Peter Coraggio’s “Electronic Sound Sculpture”.
